com.panasonic.toughpad.android.api.appbtn

Class AppButtonManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.panasonic.toughpad.android.api.appbtn.AppButtonManager

  • public final class AppButtonManager
extends java.lang.Object
    AppButtonManager can be used to control the application buttons on the Android device.

    AppButtonManager sends an intent each time a button is pressed or released to the user selected handler application.
    EXTRA_APPBUTTON_STATE contains the events raised.

    Button Type

    External Button
    BUTTON_A1
    BUTTON_A2
    BUTTON_A3
    BUTTON_USER
    BUTTON_SIDE

    Following is the additional information contained in the extra EXTRA_APPBUTTON_BUTTON
    ContentsDescription
    EXTRA_APPBUTTON_STATE_UP Triggered when the button is pressed
    EXTRA_APPBUTTON_STATE_DOWN Triggered when the button is released


    All methods must be thread-safe.

    • Method Detail

      • isButtonAvailable

        public static boolean isButtonAvailable(int button)

      • hasButtonControl

        public static boolean hasButtonControl()
        Can be used to determine if the currently running application has control over buttons.

        This can be used to show a prompt to the user, asking him to assign this application for button control, if the method returns false.

        Returns:
        True if the user has explicitely selected the current application for button control, false otherwise.
